techmeme.title: Meta CTO says the technical issues during live demos of its new smart glasses were due to a self-inflicted DDoS and a bug that put Zuckerberg's glasses to sleep (Jess Weatherbed/The Verge)
Neuralink plans a US clinical trial in October to test a brain implant that translates thoughts into text, hoping to put its device in a healthy person by 2030 (Ike Swetlitz/Bloomberg)
Trump claims he and Xi Jinping approved a deal for TikTok's US operations; Chinese media's readout only says that China respects the wishes of businesses (Ben Berkowitz/Axios)
Meta files an application for authorization "to sell energy, capacity, and certain ancillary services" in the US amid rising energy demand for AI datacenters (Bloomberg)
Report: OpenAI has considered building glasses, a digital voice recorder, and a pin, and has signed a deal with Luxshare to assemble at least one of its devices (Marcus Mendes/9to5Mac)
